Topic.Title: QDK doesn't recognize no mew line tag

Posts.EditableText:
In the QDK, if you put |xn at the end of a line that it's supposed to print, the QDK does this:
[code:3kpmyx6d]Print "Text....Text....[UNKNOWN]n"[/code:3kpmyx6d]
If you run the program, though, everything works fine.

|xn is the tag for not starting a new line at the next msg command.
Posts.HTML:
In the QDK, if you put |xn at the end of a line that it's supposed to print, the QDK does this:
Print "Text....Text....[UNKNOWN]n"

If you run the program, though, everything works fine.

|xn is the tag for not starting a new line at the next msg command.

Posts.EditableText: Probably because QDK allows you to use shift+enter and ctrl+enter to enter the new line code. Probably just an oversight.
Posts.HTML: Probably because QDK allows you to use shift+enter and ctrl+enter to enter the new line code. Probably just an oversight.

Posts.EditableText: I was talking about the tag for NO new line.  I'm writing a part of my program to randomly make descriptions...
Posts.HTML: I was talking about the tag for NO new line.  I'm writing a part of my program to randomly make descriptions...

Posts.EditableText: I'll take a look into this. It just seems that I've omitted to get QDK to print the meaning of the |xn code - this shouldn't cause any problems apart from the "[UNKNOWN]n" display in QDK though hopefully.
